result.execSummary:
The defendant Vivian D Strapp-Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other time being served.  Huber release for employment.    No electronic monitoring allowed.
The Court has no aversion to early termination of probation if after 18 months of probation all conditions are fulfilled.

miscConds.notes: $5,569.82 payable to Milwaukee Public Schools (MPS).  To be paid by the end of probation  period.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Obtain/maintain fulltime employment or fulltime school and part time employment.

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant is informed she may not possess and/or own  any firearms; and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been reinstated.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in cognitive thinking program.
Pay all supervision fees.
Court orders all mandatory costs waived due to restitution amount ordered. The Court wants repayment to MPS.

timeConds.notes: The Court finds this condition to be satisfied.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vivian D Strapp-Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vivian D Strapp-Johnson in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing on today.  Attorney Jaspers appears in place of Attorney Megan Morrisey.  This case has recently been administratively reassigned to Attorney Jaspers by the Public Defender's Office.  Defense request for adjournment granted by the Court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vivian D Strapp-Johnson in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Megan Carmody for Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea; correction regarding date (year) set forth on the record.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vivian D Strapp-Johnson in court with attorney Anne Jaspers for attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vivian D Strapp-Johnson in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vivian D Strapp-Johnson in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
